channel.title: Updaters?
channel.description:
Can anyone take the time to explain to me what the components of an updater are, how it works, and maybe even post a tutorial or link to a source :rolleyes:.
I'm clueless...

item.title: Updaters?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Tenen, post:16, topic:283246”]How do I load a class not found in the current directory?

I see there is a constructor in classfile.ClassParser that lets you specify an input stream and will get the class file from that stream. But, what I don’t get is what input stream should I give it? :|[/quote]

URLClassLoader is a quick and easy way to do it, providing you don’t have to modify anything on the fly.

Read full topic

item.title: Updaters?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:11, topic:283246”][quote author=qauters link=topic=374291.msg2825833#msg2825833 date=1244979678]
Also add the runescape.jar to your classpath!!! Because of the reflection they use
[/quote]wouldnt the idea be to not be a moron and write a classloader[/quote]
Why would you want to take time writing unnecessary stuff, when it can be solved much quicker…
It’s just for testing, so it doesn’t need to be perfect.

Also I don’t even use deobs that often, cause my reflection explorer (bad name) / editor works much nicer.
But since this is for someone else, I at least provide info.

RSBot uses the classloader way, so don’t act like I’m stupid…
I know what I’m doing, I just prefer to spend my time of something more valuable.
(All this does not apply when you want to edit something that is loaded using reflection, but that chance is minimal).

Read full topic

item.title: Updaters?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:9, topic:283246”][quote author=Tenen link=topic=374291.msg2825704#msg2825704 date=1244963778]
One last question: How I am going to start looking for patterns? My solution was to download every new revision of the Runescape client JaGEx creates, and also copy the updater outputs on these revisions. Then, once I have about three or four, I can deobfuscate them. Finally, I’ll start digging through the source code, looking for patterns.

However, this is going to take some time because Runescape presumably updates only every week. So, I was wondering if there was a quicker way? Maybe someone already has a respiratory with current revisions and deobs :eek:?

BTW, does noobcorn’s (:P) deob-er still work?
[/quote]http://moparisthebest.com/rs/bin contains all the latest revisions.

And no, it doesn’t for the latest client revisions.[/quote]
It does work, change the bat file to not delete runescape.jar, make it run it will crash.
Open runescape.jar, copy out the jagex folder (with jagmisc.class), run the deobber again.
It will now finish, in the given deob search for “” and change that to “int[]” (3 times total)
Also search for “—” and change it to “-” (2 times I believe).
Copy back the jagex folder and you’re done.
Although you can’t connect to a server, so just add in a new class that starts the applet.
Then it will work fine

Edit:
An example of a startup class: (put together from bits of rsbot as you can see)
Also add the runescape.jar to your classpath!!! Because of the reflection they use 

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.applet.AppletStub;
import java.applet.AudioClip;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Component;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.Toolkit;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.Enumeration;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Iterator;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Vector;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JScrollPane;

/**
 * @author Bert
 *
 */
public class Startup extends JFrame{

	/**
	 * 
	 */
	private static final long serialVersionUID = 593699005452841840L;

	/**
	 * @param args
	 */
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		new Startup();
	}

	client c;
	public Startup()
	{
		//get Client
		c = new client();
		BotStub bs = new BotStub(25, c);
		c.setStub(bs);
		
		initGUI();
		setVisible(true);

		bs.setActive(true);
		c.init();
		c.start();
		
	}
	
	void initGUI()
	{
		setResizable(false);
		setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE);
		// applet
		Dimension dim = new Dimension(765, 503);
		Component loader = (Component) c;
		loader.setSize(dim);
		loader.setPreferredSize(dim);
		Dimension dim2 = new Dimension(768, 506);
		JScrollPane appletScroll = new JScrollPane(loader);
		appletScroll.getViewport().setSize(dim2);
		appletScroll.setPreferredSize(dim2);
		add(appletScroll, BorderLayout.CENTER);
		pack();
	}
}


class BotStub implements AppletStub, AppletContext {
	private static final Map<URL,WeakReference<Image>> imageCache;
	private final Map<String, InputStream> inputCache;
	private final Map<String, String> parameters;
	private final int world;
	private final URL codeBase;
	private final URL documentBase;
	private final Applet applet;
	private boolean isActive;

	static {
		imageCache = new HashMap<URL,WeakReference<Image>>();
	}

	public static void clearImageCache() {
		imageCache.clear();
	}

	public void clearInputCache() {
		inputCache.clear();
	}

	public final int getWorldNumber() {
		return world;
	}

	public BotStub(int world, Applet applet) {
		this.world = world;
		this.applet = applet;
		parameters = loadParameters();
		inputCache = Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap<String, InputStream>(2));
		try {
			codeBase = new URL("http://world" + world + ".runescape.com");
			documentBase = new URL("http://world" + world + ".runescape.com/m0");
		} catch (MalformedURLException e) {
			throw new RuntimeException(e);
		}
	}

	private HashMap<String, String> loadParameters() {
		HashMap<String, String> parameters = new HashMap<String, String>();
		parameters.put("java_arguments", "\"-Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true\"");
		parameters.put("worldid", "" + world);
		parameters.put("modewhere", "0");
		parameters.put("modewhat", "0");
		parameters.put("advertsuppressed", false ? "1" : "0");
		parameters.put("lang", "0");
		parameters.put("objecttag", "0");
		parameters.put("js", "1");
		parameters.put("game", "0");
		parameters.put("affid", "0");
		parameters.put("settings", "VPEWjAdl0TmCHVq*pm8v7k7lUtJhWpNG1*WoIL-Adjg");
		parameters.put("haveie6", "1");
		parameters.put("cookieprefix", "");
		parameters.put("cookiehost", ".runescape.com");
		parameters.put("crashurl", "http://www.runescape.com/slu.ws?j=1&m=0&crash=1");
		parameters.put("unsignedurl", "http://www.runescape.com/slu.ws?j=1&m=0");
		parameters.put("pre142url", "http://world" + world + ".runescape.com/m0,j1,a1,o0");

		return parameters;
	}

	public URL getCodeBase() {
		return codeBase;
	}

	public URL getDocumentBase() {
		return documentBase;
	}

	public String getParameter(String s) {
		String parameter = parameters.get(s);
		if (s != null) {
			return parameter;
		}
		return "";
	}

	public AppletContext getAppletContext() {
		return this;
	}

	public boolean isActive() {
		return isActive;
	}

	public void setActive(boolean isActive) {
		this.isActive = isActive;
	}

	public void appletResize(int x, int y) {
		//applet.setSize(x, y);
		//log("Attempting resize: " + x + "," + y);
		//Its okay to ignore it. Its is a notification to the browser.
	}

	public Applet getApplet(String name) {
		String thisName = parameters.get("name");
		if (thisName == null) return null;
		return thisName.equals(name) ? applet : null;
	}

	public Enumeration<Applet> getApplets() {
		Vector<Applet> apps = new Vector<Applet>();
		apps.add(applet);
		return apps.elements();
	}

	public AudioClip getAudioClip(URL url) {
		log("NOT YET IMPLEMENTED getAudioClip=" + url);
		return null;
	}

	public Image getImage(URL url) {
		synchronized (imageCache) {
			WeakReference<Image> ref = imageCache.get(url);
			Image img;
			if (ref == null || (img = ref.get()) == null ) {
				img = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(url);
				ref = new WeakReference<Image>(img);
				imageCache.put(url, ref);
			}
			return img;
		}
	}

	public InputStream getStream(String key) {
		return inputCache.get(key);
	}

	public Iterator<String> getStreamKeys() {
		return Collections.unmodifiableSet(inputCache.keySet()).iterator();
	}

	public void setStream(String key, InputStream stream) throws IOException {
		inputCache.put(key, stream);
	}

	public void showDocument(URL url) {
		if(url.toString().contains("outofdate")) {
			log("===============================================================================");
			log("RSBot is currently outdated, please wait patiently for an update.");
			log("Posting a duplicate thread or a thread somewhere other than ");
			log("the download section will result in an instant BAN.");
			log("===============================================================================");
		} else {
			log("Attempting to show: " + url.toString());
		}
	}

	public void showDocument(URL url, String target) {
		if(url.toString().contains("outofdate")){
			log("===============================================================================");
			log("RSBot is currently outdated, please wait patiently for an update.");
			log("Posting a duplicate thread or a thread somewhere other than ");
			log("the download section will result in an instant BAN.");
			log("===============================================================================");
		}else
			log("Attempting to show: " + url.toString() + " [" + target + "]");
	}
	
	public void showStatus(String status) {
		log("Status: " + status);
	}

	void log(String s)
	{
		System.out.println(s);
	}
}

Read full topic

[quote=“Tenen, post:7, topic:283246”]One last question: How I am going to start looking for patterns? My solution was to download every new revision of the Runescape client JaGEx creates, and also copy the updater outputs on these revisions. Then, once I have about three or four, I can deobfuscate them. Finally, I’ll start digging through the source code, looking for patterns.

However, this is going to take some time because Runescape presumably updates only every week. So, I was wondering if there was a quicker way? Maybe someone already has a respiratory with current revisions and deobs :eek:?

BTW, does noobcorn’s (:P) deob-er still work?[/quote]http://moparisthebest.com/rs/bin contains all the latest revisions.

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

so, when I slept on it, I figured the only patterns you could really see would be the way it is used… then, I see your reply. guess I’m not that clueless after all. ;D

i guess I’ll just go over the old rs revisions and deobs

Read full topic

item.title: Updaters?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Tenen, post:3, topic:283246”]Okay, I learned BCEL and pretty much have a good knowledge of it. Did a few examples, and I’m comfortable.

But, what do you mean by “patterns”?

Let’s say runescape has an int, and it contains the player animation. So, the int changes location and name each revision. What pattern could there be? What should I look for?[/quote]

You could look for how it is used, maybe it is the only int in the entire client used in a certain method, or maybe it is the only one multiplied by 30. These ‘patterns’ are the entire purpose for your updater, and it’s no simple task to make good ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Updaters?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay, I learned BCEL and pretty much have a good knowledge of it. Did a few examples, and I’m comfortable.

Let’s say runescape has an int, and it contains the player animation. So, the int changes location and name each revision. What pattern could there be? What should I look for?

Read full topic

item.title: Updaters?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

They analyse the bytecode of the client, looking for patterns or “hooks” that can be consistently found between versions. Usually they will also inject accessor methods for fields throughout the client, allowing a bot to get information directly.
Bytecode libraries are commonly used to help with this process, a few examples:
BCEL - http://jakarta.apache.org/bcel/
ASM - http://asm.ow2.org/
Javassist - http://www.csg.is.titech.ac.jp/~chiba/javassist/
You could also write your own, following the JVM spec.

Now do some research for yourself, and revise your question a bit.

Read full topic
